bjhong02 wrote:

>
> where can i find *midfetch-filters* filter, i'm using version 1.0.0,
> should i download a new version.

Pardon me. I should have said this feature is only present in HEAD.  See 
here for the latest bundles: 
http://crawltools.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/artifacts/HEAD-heritrix/20041108171837.
St.Ack

>
> > Here's a note on midfetch filter from user manual: "Its also
> possible to
> > add in filters that are checked after the download of the HTTP
> response
> > headers but before the response content is read. Use midfetch-
> filters to
> > abort the download of content-types other than those wanted
> (Aborted
> > fetches have an annotation midFetchAbort appended to the crawl.log
> > entry). Note that unless the same filters are applied at the
> writer
> > processing step, the response headers -- but not the content --
> will
> > show in ARC files."
> >
> > Setting up a crawl, you need to browse to the filters page and add
> a
> > *midfetch-filters* filter.  The ContentTypeRegexFilter makes most
> sense
> > at the midfetch step; it looks at response content-type and runs
> the
> > supplied regex.  After adding, browse back to the settings page
> and add
> > in a regex.
> >
> > Give us a shout if it gives you trouble.
> > St.Ack
>
>
>
>
